hook.text: Worn-out jeans become a tote bag. A vintage curtain becomes a jacket. That's upcycling.

buildup.text: Unlike recycling, which breaks materials down, upcycling transforms waste into something of higher value.

discovery.text: Designers like Marine Serre build entire collections from deadstock fabric and discarded garments.

twist.text: Upcycling can't scale like factories. Each piece is unique, which makes mass adoption difficult.

climax.text: But that's the point. In a world of identical fast fashion, upcycled pieces carry real individuality.

punchline.text: Trash to treasure isn't a slogan. It's a design method.

quiz.question: How does upcycling differ from recycling in the fashion context?
options: Upcycling breaks materials into raw fibers to create new generic fabric
Upcycling transforms waste materials into items of higher value without breaking them down
Upcycling and recycling are the same process with different marketing names
